content: I usually have a clear skin but when I started using this I started getting pimples. Had to stop using this because of this reason.

name: AnnaW
title: Worked but I couldn‚Äôt stop the breakouts
content: I took these for almost three months. I was very excited about the promise of longer, thicker hair. I was worried about the breakouts though because plain biotin caused me to breakout before. I took extra vitamin B5 to prevent any acne and drank tons of water.. I can say that these definitely worked. I saw a big difference in my nails which were weak and damaged from too many gel manicures. They grew in long and strong within a week.. My hair never grew any faster but it did start to produce more oils and looked healthier but over time it was too oily and I needed to wash it often. After the second month I was no longer able to prevent breaking out. I also gained a little weight which I hear others have had a problem with on excess biotin.. I think these work especially for nail growth and hair health. However the side effects were inevitable.

name: Daisy Samantha
title: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
content: It grows your hair, and tastes good, YES IT WORKS but for less money you can buy

name: Beverly H.
title: Vitamins
content: Not too happy about the condition of the package and it being all taped up like it‚Äôs a returned item

name: Carla Dinardo
title: Good Start !
content: I'm not sure about the effectiveness yet because it's not even a month yet. So ask me again later

name: Mo
title: So far so good.... maybe
content: I give this a 3 star for right now. I have been taking this for almost a month now and the flavor is great, easy to chew and swallow. I am taking as directed but have only noticed growth. My hair has not gotten thicker and the shedding has not decreased as a matter of fact I think I am shedding a bit more. I have decided to take this alone and stopped taking biotin and iron to see if this alone will help me get thickness. I have not broken out as bad as others; maybe 2-3 breakouts around my chin but a good skin regimen helps. I will keep you posted after this first bottle is done with and I am on to my 2nd one.

name: Daisy
content: I'm wondering if they are real. I've watched videos and starting to think this product is a knock off.

name: Daisy Boyar
title: Didn't work on me. It did on my mom
content: I heard a lot of good things about this product, so I bought it. It did make my hair thicker, and I noticed less hair falling out when I brushed it, but my hair didn't grow and I took it for about 4 months. However, I do have thick curly hair, my mom has straight, thin hair and she took it too. Her hair did grow a bit in the 4 months.

name: Chelsea Weaver
title: Oily Skin
content: The good news is you'll have long luxurious hair. The bad news is that you might have to use it to hide your face! Hah I don't have sensitive skin and have never had acne in my entire life, not even as an adolescent. However, this product is making my skin break out pretty bad. Its a shame because it did help my hair grow.

name: Debbie Gavin
title: They cause GI issues....
content: I have been using the gummies for about a week- with that being said, I obviously haven't seen any change in my hair but I feel compelled to report that I have had some serious stomach issues. I feel bloated and have felt very uncomfortable. I haven't added anything different to my diet so I would assume that it is the gummies. I am going to continue to take them and see if the side effects go away...

name: Christina
title: They taste good but they're not anything special
content: They do taste good and it wasn't a chore taking them. But the price? Yikes. This is just one type of vitamin. I cannot imagine taking different ones each month, and trying to budget this in. I assure you, you can find a better hair vitamin for way less. I used them for a few months and I did see a slight difference in my hair, but not enough to justify the costs.

name: Nicole EEe
title: Extreme hair growth, BUT
content: After I had a total hysterectomy, my hair completely stopped growing. For two years! I was desperate and tried EVERYTHING. Finally caved and tried sbh. They taste amazing. THEY WORK! My non-growing hair, grew over six inches in three months. Plus it looked so much thicker and healthier.. The issue is that they also caused cystic acne on my checks and jawline. I‚Äôd never had that before. It‚Äôs extremely painful and takes forever to go away.. After three months, I dropped to once daily for two months, but the acne was still a pretty big issue. So unfortunately I had to stop using them. I would say once daily was perfectly fine too. My hair was still growing and looked great. The final issue is just how expensive they are.

name: Elena
title: No noticeable difference between this and Nature's Bounty
content: I tried these for 3 months and I really liked it! However I didn't see a difference between this and Hair Skin Nails from Nature's Bounty in terms of my hair health and how fast my nails and eyelashes were growing. So, I am not ordering them anymore. However I really liked the flavor. I didn't like how it was sort of like a laffy taffy in sticking to your teeth for a bit. It is the mushy kind of gummy. Not sure why there is an easy to swallow rating because I am pretty sure you should chew gummies and not swallow them. Nothing wrong with it but since I don't see a noticeable difference and it's not in my budget so I won't be ordering anymore.

name: Amazon Customer
title: Didn‚Äôt workout for me
content: i have seen alot of good reviews & also a social media influencer rave about this. I had just cut my hair & wanted to speed up the grow back process. So i finally gave it a shot, and honestly i don‚Äôt see a difference & its been a month. It did make me break out like many people have said. I am one to hardly ever break out too but i was willing to stick it out since it wasn‚Äôt too bad. I wanted it to work but sadly it didn‚Äôt. Usually i take bioton supplements which are way cheaper & actually work.

name: Tina
title: It worked but meh..
content: I had switched from hair finity .. and all i can say is that a month supply i dont feel its enough , but it made my hair thicker and more stronger .. it did grow as well like maybe 2 inches close to three but i cant complain i gave it three stars because i feel even though this product worked for me a lil bit i feel you gotta take extra things with these gummys like an actual supplement to add it wih this thats just my opinion i took these with my biotin pills of 5k mg . So like i said i cant complain i dont think many people would care for this it did for me but one month supply isnt gonna be enough i feel after a couple of months you will see more results

name: Emily
title: Didn‚Äôt work for me
content: nails are brittle and hair is thinning. Took these for over 4 months but did not see an improvement. I was hopeful.

name: Amber
title: Great growth, but with side effects.
content: In my first few weeks of taking sugarbear hair, I did not notice a huge increase in manageability but there was a slight decrease in shedding. My bangs grew 2 inches in the first 2 weeks and the rest of my hair had an overall average growth of 1.5 inches by the end of the month. A huge negative was the fact that I started to break out during the third week, and it became so bad in the final week that I had to stop taking them. I don't have acne prone skin since leaving teenagehood but the gummies gave me hives and breakouts. I still mark them pretty high because the taste is enjoyable, which makes taking the gummies very easy, I had great growth results early on, and the fact that my reaction may be an anomaly based on other reviewers.

name: Bella
title: BEWARE: Caused me to break out :/
content: Please pay attention to the form of the vitamins you allow into your life. The following ingredients cause cystic acne: Vitamin A (Palmitate), which is the only form of Vitamin A that has this effect, Vitamin C (Ascorbic Acid), and Vitamin E (dI-Alpha Tocopheryl Acetate).

name: Rawan Meshraky
title: I used this product it doesn‚Äôt really work and it‚Äôs expensive I do not recommend buying it.
content: It didn‚Äôt work good I didn‚Äôt feel anything and it is expensive I don‚Äôt recommend buying this product at all it‚Äôs a waste of money.

name: Paige  Palmer
title: Not great quality
content: Second order from Amazon, first order they tasted great, second order they are discolored and not as chewy, like maybe they were left out to long? Not sure, but next purchase will come from sugar bear theirselves.

name: PrimeMoody
title: They worked, but aren't worth the money or the hype.
content: Tried this product for one month, it was OK. It did cause me to break out more than usual which was frustrating. I've noticed the most improvement in my nails, they are gorgeous and growing longer and stronger than ever before. Hair-wise, I've noticed a difference in how healthy my hair feels. I can tell that my hair is getting stronger, although I can't say I see any significant growth in the last month. Did the vitamins do what they promised? I'd say yes. Will I buy it again? No. I don't think they are worth the pricetag when I can get something similar that doesn't make me break out at the drugstore.. First two photos are day one of the vitamin, last photo is last day of one month supply. No noticeable growth difference in my opinion.

name: Emma grg
title: Not worth it
content: I have finished 2 of the bottles and still my hair doesn't seem any changes in growth, shinier, neither stop hair falling. I don't know why people give good review about this. Definitely not buying again. Unhappy custumer

name: Elle
title: Tastes great, but caused break outs
content: I really wanted to love this. I bought the one month supply, and took the vitamin for about 2 and a half weeks. The vitamin is delicious (hard not to be with 2g of sugar per serving!), and I do think I was starting to notice some improvement in my hair, but more than that I began to seriously break out all over my face. I don't typically get acne very often, and when I do it's one or two zits. This was all over my forehead, a place I typically don't break out. I decided to stop taking the bears for a week and my acne immediately cleared up.. Sad to say these vitamins just aren't for me. I am sure other people have different reactions, my body is just more sensitive to sugar or some ingredient in the vitamin, it seems.

name: Jennifer Lorme
title: Makes you go hmmmm
content: It seems these may be a little old. They are more greenish blue than baby blue. A little harder than on a regular but direct. Seem to still taste the same sorta. Guess we‚Äôll see how hen I get next months supply.

name: Amazon Customer
title: ... that my nails look healthier and stronger despite my bad nail chewing habit
content: I've noticed that my nails look healthier and stronger despite my bad nail chewing habit. Also, I have this one hair in the middle of my widow's peak that I tend to always pluck out. It just is awkwardly the only hair at the tip of the peak so it bothers me. I plucked it out before I started the product. However, only three weeks into my first month of this product this strand of hair has grown half an inch, along with all my hair. I bleached and dyed my hair constantly the past 4 years so it's been horrible. With these gummies, my hair feels thicker and shinner! I love them. However, my when I counted my gummies I noticed I was missing 3 which is annoying considering we are already paying so much for these pills.

name: Gerardo
title: plomo en las gomitas
content: estan muy buenas y al parecer son buenas tomando dos frascos pero ya no las vamos a ordenar miramos en youtube videos de mujeres que les salio plomo en la sangre despues de tomar dos frascos la verdad no se las recomiendo ayy que buscar otro tipo de vitamina con biotin

name: CeeCee
title: Tasty but sugary
content: I have taken these for about 2 years! I have a HUGE fear of choking on pills because I have. Sugarbear? I love them but I am now big on reading nutritional fact labels and noticed these have sooooo much sugar! It‚Äôs like taking a spoonful of sugar! I have to discontinue taking them because of it! The flavor just became to sweet for me. Cute little bears but not worth the sugar intake. If I can get around this fact, I do have to admit it did help a bit with hair growth and I‚Äôve seen a big difference in my nails! I can only imagine what healthier vitamins will do!

name: Christina Eno
title: No Results, I‚Äôm Sad.
content: Been a month and I have not noticed any change in the length, fullness, or overall appearance of my hair and nails. I had high hopes for these because of all the hype from ‚ÄúFamous‚Äù people. Ugh I don‚Äôt know why I fall for that type of advertising, my hair will never look like a Kardashian because I‚Äôm not part Armenian lol. I didn‚Äôt expect a big change in a month but at least expected a slight change in my nails or even the baby hairs around my face. Nada, it‚Äôs all the same. I will give these one more month and will update. But so far 30 days and not a single sign of them working.

name: Carin Weatherly Johnson
title: Just can't decide on these
content: Conflicted about these... I originally received a 14 day supply sample in the mail and there is no doubt in my mind that my hair grew; considerably enough that I went ahead and bought a jar of these. However I used the entire jar of them, which was a much larger quantity than my sample, and didn't feel like I noticed the difference that I did with the sample ones. I began to question if they make the strength of the sample vitamins stronger too entice you into buying them?? I might try buying them one more time in the future, just to see how they work, but like I said I'm very conflicted about them.

name: Xavier Serrano
title: Good taste, terrible value
content: This product wasn't actually for me it was for a friend who was actually pregnant and was losing her hair (for some reason) and was recommend to take this product. To be completely honest she didn't make any comments about the product so Im assuming she didn't feel anything "out of the normal vitamin product". Pros. - She did say gummies tasted good. Cons. - This is a terrible value at this price point it only gives you 60 gummies and you have to take 2 a day so that makes it almost a $1 dollar per gummy. I do believe there are better prices available but I wouldn't call it a bad product

name: Nicolle
title: Not a miracle
content: This is a before and after shot of one month on this product. Benefits don‚Äôt out weigh the side effects in my opinion. I cut my hair off very short to donate it. It doesn‚Äôt seem like I noticeable difference in growth unless I look at pictures. The growth could have been all my own for all I know. Before buying I did read a lot of reviews from others saying they got some acne as a side affect but was so desperate that I ignored their warnings. Unfortunately I did get a lot of acne around my cheek bones, lower lip, and jawline.. The gummies themselves taste great though.

name: judy
title: Quick delivery.
content: Did not like the flavor.

name: Lucia Rivera
title: Aun estoy  en el proceso llevo 30 dias tomandolo
content: Si saben bien y facil de tragar

name: Amazon Customer
content: Taste absolutley amazing...though I cannot say I saw a difference is my hair growth.

name: Bebe
title: Opened bottle.
content: When I got my sugar bear hair the plastic was still on the top but it looked like someone had already opened it and when I opened it myself, the little sealed covering for it was half opened and I checked to make sure that there were 60 pieces but it was 62. I'm still taking them but if I knew that the bottle was going to be already opened and all of that I would've just paid 3 more dollars and gotten it from the website itself. All in all, they do taste great but it's only been less than a week. I'm not sure if anyone else has had the same problem I've had and I hope that this review helps.

name: kirstiboo
title: I've paid more for less
content: Pretty sure I just bought 2 months supply of good ol' regular gummie bears. How do they taste? Delicious. Like fruit punch. Easy to chew. Dissolve fairly quickly. How do you take them? 2 a day every day. Benefits? For me, none whatsoever. My nails are still their same fragile breakable selves. My hair is still growing at it's usual snail's pace. Complete with split ends and breakage. Overall: would I buy them a third time? Nope. Never. I'll go back to my go to. Would I recommend them? Sure. They're delicious. They didn't work for ME. Didn't say it was a bad product.

name: Amanda Myers
title: Worth a try!
content: After seeing these all over Instagram, I finally decided to give these a try. They taste okay and I felt like after a month I could see a difference in my hair growth. They don't hurt my stomach like some other vitamins do. It was kind of fun to pop one in the morning and other one at night. I started to look forward to it. They are pretty expensive for vitamins, so I plan on trying out a few different brands before possibly going back to this. Another thing, they got pretty stale towards the end, even though I had the lid sealed the whole time - maybe it was just my bottle.

name: Maria
title: I still shed a good amount of hair after washing in the shower
content: I have only been taking for 3 months but I haven't noticed any significant growth or change. I still shed a good amount of hair after washing in the shower. And I still have a good amount of hair on my brush. I noticed a better and faster change in just taking regular Natrol Biotin supplements and they're only $8 plus you get way more in a bottle. For me, Sugar Bears are not worth the money every month. I think it depends on the person, I'm sure they work for some. They do taste good! I take them with my daily multivitamin and it's a nice added treat. It tastes like a berry mix.

name: Amazon Customer
title: Okay.
content: I like them okay, I am not sure if they work as well as everyone rants and raves about, but that review could be because you need to be consistent with them.. Use them for many many months in a row, I do wish they were a bit more affordable so I could justify paying and trying for more months. They are really tasty, and they are so cute, I will say that. :D So if it is in your budget to try for a long while I would give it a shot, but if money is tight I wouldn't put money toward it otherwise.. -Dreaming of healthy hair

name: NP
title: not for me
content: Product not for me. They DO taste like sugary greatness, BUT they did cause me to break out (larger, under-the-skin type pimples that I don't ever normally get). I didn't use 2 per day everyday due to causing breakouts so I can't speak to effectiveness of product on hair improvement if used as directed. For me, I didn't see a difference in my hair length or "beauty" with taking 1 every day or every other day. Plus, you can purchase other hair,skin, nail gummies from local grocery/drug store for much less money and nearly identical ingredients. Would not purchase again or recommend personally.

name: Celia
title: Highly recommend: -) Update After taking them for 2 month ...
content: I have noticed that my eyelashes grew back!! I lostmost of my eyelashes do to wearing eyelash extentions for long period of time. I have also noticed my hair has grown and it's a lot shinier and soft! Its only been 1 month for me and I'm ordering a second bottle! Highly recommend :-). Update. After taking them for 2 month I started breaking out bad even when I drank plenty of water. I stopped taking them and my skin cleared up and decided to go with a more affordable biotin gummy for only $10.00 (5,000 mg) and no break out what so ever and have had great results in hair & nail growth

name: Stefanie
title: Works but definitely gives you acne
content: I dunno it works for sure. I have super thin hair and it definitely caused some baby hairs to grow, but like a lot of people on here said. It gave me acne like a teenager. I‚Äôm not sure why...it definitely does what it‚Äôs supposed to and isn‚Äôt gross or anything but acne

name: Taylor
title: Possible cause of acne
content: I received these vitamins about 2 weeks ago...obviously I don‚Äôt expect to see results that quickly but what I do see is acne on my cheeks and forehead ! Hence I usually have EXTREMELY clear skin and have thankfully never battled acne . Probably TMI but it is my time of the month so fingers crossed that is to blame for the breakout because I have HIGH hopes for these little bears !! I will post an update in another 2 weeks to see if the breakout has diminished .. (They do taste ABSOLUTELY AMAZING tho !!)

name: Nora
title: Didn't look like the pictures
content: This was the wrong color and had a description on it. I cant return it so I'm giving it a review instead.

name: Amazon Customer
title: There is not 60 in there- must be 59 as my last day for the month is tomorrow and I only have 1 gummie left--I've been taking 2 a day like it instructs
content: I'm just curious as to why I got an odd number of vitamins in the package? There is not 60 in there- must be 59 as my last day for the month is tomorrow and I only have 1 gummie left--I've been taking 2 a day like it instructs. I've seen other people with this issue in the reviews. So far as it's only been a month, haven't noticed too much of a difference with my hair (I am measuring) but my nails are growing like crazy- I opted in for the 3 month subscription so i'll re-review at that time.

name: Mariah Westermark
title: Good product strange residue on packaging
content: I love this product! Only issue was the packaging. There was some strange smelly residue all over the bottle. It didn‚Äôt seem to get under the plastic wrapped around the bottle but I had to wash it with soap and water because it smelled like dog. Have had these vitamins before, again love the vitamins! But weird packaging I didn‚Äôt appreciate.

name: Huda
title: It works, but it can cause acne
content: I tried this product for the first time. It‚Äôs easy to take, doesn‚Äôt have a bad flavor and it‚Äôs little gummy bears which encourages you to take them daily.. It has definitely helped my hair and has been working and has helped grow hair where it was thinning. However, if your skin is sensitive it will cause break outs. My face has suffered and I only ordered the 1 month supply. I am at a crossroads because although the product helps my hair, the skin breakouts are a problem.

name: Terri CLark
title: They're okay...
content: Not as highly rated as other like products. I saw no difference in hair growth.

name: rizzo
title: Nothing new
content: Tested this product to see what the hype is about. They taste so yummy it was hard to not eat them all. Followed the instructions but results were not forthcoming. Perhaps this item is for you as it did not have effect on me. Check with your doctor before taking any vitamins or supplements. Enjoy and please don‚Äôt eat them all at once.

name: Laura
title: Funciona pero...
content: Mi cabello sigue callendose pero ya es menos que antes, a√∫n no llevo ni un mes tom√°ndolas. Pero si note que se cae menos. El color no es muy agradable a la vista, en realidad pensar√≠a otra vez en volver a comprarlas, su aspecto no es agradable pero tienen buen sabor aunque est√°n un poco lacias.

name: Jessica Garrett
title: Thicker Lashes but irritated skin
content: Ordered at the recommendation of a friend who had success with these vitamins. They do taste good and are easy to swallow. After a week, my eyelashes were thicker and I was hopeful. However, after a month, skin became dry and blotchy, and I drink plenty of water. I would rather have clear skin. FYI, I am a black female in her 40s.

name: Lauren
title: Too much hype
content: These vitamins got a lot of hype, I think they're pretty decent. I do feel like they're overpriced considering the other gummies you can get for hair, skin and nails. Also my skin began breaking out when I took these more than normal though I did change a few other things like shampoo during the same time so I can't say it was because of these. Basically you should just go to target and buy two bottles of gummies there it will run you close to the same price and you'll reap the benefits for much longer than 30 days

name: RW
title: Going back to the basics and trying better shampoos/conditioners/deep conditioning treatments without sulfates/silicone
content: This seemed to help my hair grow, but after getting a little over half way through the bottle my skin was a mess. This won't be the case for everyone as we all react differently. I normally have small blemishes here and there, but while taking these my skin began breaking out regularly. I decided to stop taking them because it didn't seem worth jeopardizing my skin for longer hair. Going back to the basics and trying better shampoos/conditioners/deep conditioning treatments without sulfates/silicone. If you give it a chance, I hope it works for you!

name: Eliza Ellis
title: overall decent
content: personally i don‚Äôt like the flavor next time i will be ordering off the sugar bear website but overall good and i‚Äôm only on my first bottle and it has gave me a little acne

name: Katherine
title: Not the Correct amount
content: This is my second order and again I had 1 gummy left instead of 2 like the dosage is supposed to be daily. I‚Äôm taking 2 gummies daily and when I completed it‚Äôs always one left instead of 2 at my first order I thought it was me who took more that 2 but now secos order the same left over ? Not possible

name: Silantro
title: Color looks a bit off.
content: I‚Äôm not sure if these are a wee bit aged or if they‚Äôve been exposed to too much heat but the gummies look a bit jacked up and darker in color than usual. As for the effectiveness of the supplement I haven‚Äôt been taking these long enough to fairly comment.

name: dawson plum
title: I can‚Äôt tell..
content: So I got these vitamins because they became pretty popular. I decided to give them a try and I honestly didn‚Äôt see much of a difference in my hair. MAYBE my hair got a little softer? Idk. It‚Äôs not worth all the rave to me. Although, they do taste good and are super cute

name: Mary
title: Gummies?
content: I don't really know if they work. I took the whole bottle because I don't want to waste money but I totally missed the part about them being gummies! I take all my stuff after brushing my teeth at night and kept forgetting to chew the little gummies BEFORE I brushed at night. That was annoying to have to remember to do that. I'm going to look to see if they have a capsule option. Hopefully they will. I wont order more gummies.

name: Bryant Lee Bird
title: Great yum yum tasting hair vitamins.. Thanks
content: My hair never grew back at all since I had it cut months ago.. I want my length to increase fast

name: mustlovewine
title: I think I might be losing hair..
content: Taste great. Easy to chew. Haven‚Äôt seen any positive changes, actually feel like my hair is thinning.

name: J N
title: Sticks to my teeth
content: I‚Äôm not a huge fan of gummy bears. They‚Äôre too sweet and I‚Äôm not a fan of if getting stuck on my teeth. Would definitely prefer this in a pill form. I haven‚Äôt seen any drastic changes since using it. It‚Äôs not a bad product.

name: Jennifer
title: It‚Äôs ok
content: I saw 0 results from taking this everyday for 3 months. To expensive

name: chris roxas
title: Somethings wrong
content: The texture is not gummy ish. It felt reallt dry and when i bit into it its kinda starchy and broke down to a lot of pieces. I owned the actual product that i bought from their website b4 and that 1 is like gummy bear. Idk if its just the way it was shipped maybe it was sitting on the vehicle for a long time plus the heat or its just the product itself.

name: Alivea
title: Iffy
content: Flavor was awesome I‚Äôm not too sure about the texture though, and as for results I didn‚Äôt see much of a difference

name: Natalie
title: Taste great, not effective for hair growth
content: I really wanted to like these vitamins after seeing many Instagram posts and online reviews. The vitamins taste delicious, like candy, and are easy to remember to take 2x a day. While the vitamins tasted great, I didn't notice any dramatic increase in my hair length. The levels of Biotin in these supplements are not that strong. I will not be repurchasing this item due to the price and the low level of Biotin. I'd recommend Viviscal Vitamins if you are comfortable with a $30 price tag or honestly just buy Biotin vitamins for much cheaper.

name: Natalia
title: Did not work for me
content: I know vitamins depend on each person, but for me particularly did not work. I'm finishing the third bottle and I noticed no change in my hair. It keeps shedding ALL the time. But the gummies are nice in flavor (I'm not a gummy person) and easy to ingest.

name: Ayana Stewart
title: Headaches and Gas everyday? Not worth it.
content: Though these taste so good, I‚Äôm going to have to pass. I had so much gas it was insane. It was the type of gas that made you want to throw up. I had gas the entire day for 6 days straight. OH and let‚Äôs not forget the headaches. I had a headache every day. It was painful. As soon as I stopped taking the vitamins my headache and gas went away. Is gas and headaches a price to pay for possible hairgrowth? No.

name: Kenzy Samsen
title: Like everyone has said
content: Like everyone has said, they taste amazing! To be honest, I didn't always take them as directed and either skipped days or took more tham 2 a day, and I totally didn't take any progress pictures, BUT I would say that my hair has been feeling a lot longer in the last few weeks (and I started taking biotin supplements after my bears were gone). Honestly, I probably wouldn't spend another 30 dollars on a bottle of these when I can buy strawberry-flavored biotin tablets for a third of that price, but it was fun to try them out.

name: Jacqui
title: Yummy but not sure about results
content: Just finished my first month of gummies. I haven't noticed much difference to be honest. I think my hair is falling out just as much as it did before, so it definitely hasn't gotten any thicker, but perhaps slightly longer? Not sure if that's due to time or the vitamins. I also noticed my armpit hair is growing in faster than before.. so while that is unwanted, perhaps my head hair is growing too. I am going to give them a shot for one more month and see what happens. They taste good, at least!

name: Sherry
title: Hair gummies
content: Outside of the fact that they taste great, look cute and are easy to chew, it did absolutely nothing for my hair. Or my nails. I used these for about nine months and with no results I decided to discontinue use.

name: Destiny Marie
title: Overpriced
content: These do taste great, but I feel they are overpriced for what they are. I saw no hair growth in the month that I took these, just less hair shed and some growth in my nails. I had no problems with break outs. I honestly do not see myself spending $30 on these every month so I bought a cheaper kind of gummy hair vitamins by nutrablast which also taste great for half the price and have 90 gummies versus the 60 gummies sugar bear offers.

name: Keila
title: Good but can‚Äôt poop
content: So they do taste great .. but I took for two weeks and I couldn‚Äôt go to the restroom ! The biotin slows down your intestine and you could end up with serious digestive issues ! I had to stop taking them ! :(

name: Abster
title: Definite hair growth but...
content: More than half way through the bottle, I noticed faster growth hair than normal which was great. Unfortunately, I also noticed my natural arm hair and facial hair growing. I don‚Äôt wax because my body hair is very light and minimal, but I stopped taking these because i don‚Äôt want to start waxing. It also did give me acne. Overall it works, hair grows but since I don‚Äôt wax, I don‚Äôt want the extra hair growth that comes with it.

name: Amazon Customer
title: Let's see how this goesü§û
content: Not giving a full 5 stars until I see my results. I'm giving 3 stars for now for great flavor these gummies taste really yummy! And for a great delivery no cracks or broken seal or melted gummies. So let's see how this goesü§û

name: Janeth
title: Eh.
content: I did two months of these vitamins. The only thing that grew were my eyelashes. They are beautiful! I love them... buuut, my hair did not grow whatsoever. I did not break into acne, thank goodness, but I did have a minor stomach ache whenever I missed a day and I took it. Overall, it's eh. If you want to grow out your hair, rub coconut oil/water on your roots. I've been doing that since the beginning of October and now being Mid November-ish my hair grew an inch. Not bad!

name: Maria Ibanez
title: Nada
content: No vi resultados mi pelo sigue cayendo mucho no vi cambio en mi u√±as.

name: Ashley
title: Cheaper alternatives
content: They taste great, but they're expensive and there are cheaper alternatives. Definitely doesn't promote new hair growth but likely helps with length.

name: LaToya Davis-Hollis
title: Decent product, not as effective as I thought it would be
content: There was some extra new hair growth, but I experienced new facial acne as well. So, I limited my consumption to every other day and it stopped. In 4 months my hair grew about 2 inches more.

name: pris
title: Anything with biotin has a possibility of having some breskout activity
content: I believe these vitamins work good. They're a but pricey in my opinion. Also... I see in the reviews people are complaining about breakouts. Anything with biotin in it has a high possibility of causing breakouts. Biotin helps other parts of the body like hair and nails. But it also messes with the barrier function of the skin. Just wanted to throw that out there üëç

name: Zen*Yogi*Girl
title: Weird taste and texture that is hard to get past
content: Baffled at the popularity of these because they are not very pleasant at all! They have the texture of checking gum that has been chewed and left to set and a weird taste that can be best described as when you get ice that is from a machine that is not very clean and has a weird sulphur taste - mixed with some kind of overly fruity flavor. Once I got that chewing gum thing in my mind it was had to overcome.. They are also priced extraordinarily high and yes they do have many extra vitamins than a traditional biotin gummy - I prefer to take a daily multivitamin that has everything I need and not have my biotin mixed with a bunch more as your body can only absorb so many vitamins anyways.. That said you do get 2 months supply in this pack so that together with the 15 key vitamins and minerals might make this a good buy for someone that does not take any other supplements.. As for claims about hair and nail growth - yes biotin can help but the results are individual for everyone and vitamins are not subject to FDA regulations so it will be a matter of try them and see if they work for you !. They are okay but I cannot get past the taste and texture.

name: Yume J Collado
title: Finally made fully vegan!
content: FINALLY they made their products fully vegan!!

name: Jazmyne Contreras
title: Average at best.
content: I usually try to use products for about 1 month before I write a review to make sure I am getting optimum benefit from the product.. I received this as a gift for my birthday in January and I just finished the bottle about a week ago. While I do see scalp growth for my hair and the hair overall grows faster, I don‚Äôt necessarily see it as healthier? I have a lot of flyaways and breakage still. My hair is died a light brown so the dark brown hair growing in is having breakage as well. My nails I see no improvement and my skin has a lot of breakouts along my chin and forehead. I‚Äôve also had a few ingrown hairs around the hairline. I‚Äôve also notice I have persistently gotten in grown hairs in my armpits with the rapid hair growth, currently I have 3 in one arm and one in the other arm. Not sure if this is from the gummies but this has never been a problem before.. The taste of the product over all is good the size is manageable. Product price is a little expensive for only a months supply.. It‚Äôs not a product I‚Äôd purchase myself but it was good for being a gift

name: Ashlyn
title: Not that big of a deal
content: I wanted to see what all the hype was about. Didn‚Äôt make any difference compared to taking any cheap multivitamin. Hair not growing any faster compared to taking another vitamin or no vitamin at all. Will not be making the investment again

name: JesusSaves
title: Not noticeable enough compared to other biotin gummies
content: I took a before and after 3 months picture. Took the gummies like clockwork. I didn't notice much difference in growth of my hair but I did notice I started breaking out. üòï I had high hopes for a big change because of all the great reviews.. Positives: one pack came with two extra gummies. The gummies taste amazing!!! The texture is like a starburst but better flavor.. Negatives: So much sugar it made me break out. Cost is too high.. Neutral: My hair did grow over the 3 months but not noticeably more than normal.. I trimmed my hair once during the 3 months but only half an inch. So my hair grew maybe an inch. My hair is dry in the before picture and wet in the after so my wet hair hangs a little longer. Total growth I'd say is an inch....at most an inch and a half in 3 months.. I'm taking Vitafusion extra strength Biotin gummies now that I ran out of these. Texture is about the same and has a delicious blueberry flavor. Sugars are 3g. I'll update this with results from those after 3 months for comparison.

name: Anonymous Customer
title: Maybe they work, maybe they dont
content: I didn‚Äôt order mine from amazon, I got my from the Sugar Bear Hair website but I just wanted to give my take. I am almost done with my second bottle, just a few more days left. I finished my first bottle April 3rd, and it seems like my hair grew an inch. . Today is now May 3rd, but I just measured my hair and it hasn‚Äôt grown at all. I measure in a few different spots and some parts of my hair grew a quarter of an inch but that‚Äôs it, my hair was 9.5inches on April 3rd and today it is still 9.5inches. Kind of disappointed. I miss having long hair :/ I will update again after my last bottle. Just an FYI, I am bi-racial, half black and half Hispanic, naturally curly hair.

name: Amazon Customer
title: Working so far!
content: So I decided to buy these after reading a lot of positive reviews. I'm only on day 6 so I cannot give a review based on hair health yet but I wanted to write about the acne part of it. I actually have had problems with acne as an adult. By day 3 of taking these my existing acne that I haven't been able to get rid of had significantly improved. So while this may cause more acne for others, it seems to be working for mine. Also my nails are amazing. Using the majority of my strength, I cannot even bend my fingernails! I'll update once I see results with my hair.

name: A
title: Please read! This is good to know !

There are some exactly like sugarbear hair on Amazon (even yummy little gummy bears ) you get the exact ingredients and they aren‚Äôt 30$! About 14 with the 5% coupon.. anyways. Being honest and giving reviews help people decide what is best. And in my honest opinion sugarbear hair isn‚Äôt the best. There are cheaper ways to get beautiful hair!

name: bunnylover22
title: WHY IT MAKES YOU BREAK OUT
content: Yes, this product WILL make you break out. But it isn't the product itself- Its the Biotin levels. No matter what hair skin or nail supplement that you take, you're gunna break out. Sorry. Any increase of Biotin levels you take into yourself will make you break out. this product has more Biotin then others which is why it makes you break out so much more than perhaps other products. If you want long hair, you may have to sacrifice your clear skin.

name: amanda barr
title: WARNING
content: Im taking the time to leave this review so people know that there is a good chance of getting acne as a side effect. I took these vitamins for 2 months and watched my originally clear skin break out worse and worse. I didn't want to believe it was from the gummies and went to my dermatologist who told me to immediately stop taking them. He told me it's pretty common for people to get breakouts and acne from biotin and that the form and amount of biotin can make a difference.I switched back to just the pill form of biotin and my skin started improving right away. While I noticed my hair grew faster(twice as fast as usual) the gummies didn't help with my brittle hair and the scars on my face are still noticeable. I would definitely suggest if you're going to try them just take one a day.

title: good for growing you hair fast but it affect all the body hair
content: I have been using it for about 6 months now.. it tastes very good and it is so soft not sticky like haribo which is good for crown and it is very gentle on my stomach doesn't hurt like other rich biotin hair tablets.. my hair is growing faster than before and the amount of hair loss is less, but it doesn't regrow new hair.. I removed one star as it is expensive and I can't afford to pay ¬£25 every month of just one type of supplement.. I removed my second star as my facial hair and body hair are growing so fast now, I have to wax my moustache every week and i used to do it every month also my brows need cleaning every week now so you can imagine what will happen to the body hair. My skin became a bit oily and spots started to appear as well while using it.. When I stopped it for 2 weeks, my skin cleared dramatically but I noticed I was losing hair a lot more so now I'm taking just one sugarbear/day to stop the hair loss and it's working fine less facial hair growth and less oily spotty skin.. so if you want to grow longer healthy hair i do recommend it.

content: Doesnt really do much in making a difference. It's what u get for buying something endorsed by celebrities with so many other privileges at their disposal to make them look good. Like a gummy isnt gonna do all that

content: The manufacturers must have lost their minds when they changed a most delicious, almost like a candy and not a vitamin, to the current, nearly inedible, plastic texture, nasty tasting gummy ever! I don‚Äôt know how I will get through the bottle but I can assure you that I will never again buy this product!!!

name: K. Kennedy
title: Something is Different/Seeking Answers
content: Something has changed. Been using for years & all of a sudden they are not as flavorful, not soft & squishy as before. Need to know about changes when they are tinkering with formula or ingredients or possibly being produced in a different manufacturer‚Äôs facility??

name: Amazon Customer
title: Different from original ones
content: This new packaging is different and they taste different from the ones I originally ordered. I will. Not be taking them and the cannot be returned either.. I would not buy these from Amazon

name: A. O'HARA
title: Still skeptical
content: I've seen these vitamins on instagram with a lot of promotion and a lot of good ratings, but I usually don't buy into that crap. But I've been wanting to grow out my hair for the longest time, so when I saw them on Amazon and read the reviews I thought I should give them a shot. I'm down to two days left in my one month supply but I still don't know if they're worth buying again. My hair is naturally curly/wavy, due to the fact that in half black half filipino. I don't dye my hair hair, don't put heat on it since I wear it natural, and I trim it twice a year. My hair before taking these has normal thickness, but I have a lot of fallout, and it has always been shiny and has a lot of elasticity even without product. So within this one month period I haven't seen much change with that. And my hair length has always stopped growing at my nipple, so that's the main reason why I tried these supplements, but still in the one month period haven't seen any change in that either. And for my nails, my nails have always been super long and strong so I haven't seen a difference in that. It didn't give me any breakouts taking them so that's good, and they taste delicious, even when I normally hate eating anything that has gelatin consistency, but I would eat the whole bottle if I could. But I guess I'll try one more month supply but if I don't see a difference in the second month then I'm not spending any more money on these things.

name: Brianna Kuta
title: Didn‚Äôt work for me.
content: They didn‚Äôt work nails still weak and brittle. Didn‚Äôt do much for my hair either used for around 3 months.

name: felix perez
title: This is the real color ?
content: I‚Äôve been buying this product for years and this is the first time that I see it in this color. Even the gummy‚Äôs are supposed to be a little bear and I see different things.

name: Reo
title: Sadly disappointed and left where I started
content: I was recently recommended to try these on my hair growth journey. I was very excited while reviewing this product and reading testimonies. So I decided to go for it. I have bought this product the past 4 months and taken them religiously as stated on the bottle. After the first month I saw no outcome, but I thought I should give it more than a month. Therefore I bought this product 3 more times using this product a total of 4 months. After 4 months I still have seen NO results. Not even a little bit. Again, I would take the vitamins along with completely a variety of tasks to help my hair grow. I am so extremely disappointed and frustrated with this product. I feel like I wasted a lot of money and gave it a real shot but have nothing to show. I would not recommend this product to those who are looking for more support while on their hair growth journey.

name: Irene Rose
title: Not great‚Ä¶
content: The quality is inconsistent.

name: Vanessa
title: Doesn‚Äôt work
content: I was taking these vitamins for 5 months and saw no results. Canceled subscription, saving my money. Gave it 2 stars because they taste so good but that‚Äôs about it. It‚Äôs a sweet tooth satisfier.

name: Chelsea
title: Don't hate, but I am very fortunate in the skin ...
content: Don't hate, but I am very fortunate in the skin department, I've never had bad breakouts, only the occasional pimple here & there. I read the reviews that said it caused acne, but since I haven't had issues with breaking out in the past and have also been used to taking vitamins with high levels of biotin in it, I went ahead and purchased these. My skin DEFINITELY suffered! I then switched from taking 2 gummies at once to taking one in the morning and one in the evening and drinking a ton of water after each gummy. This seemed to help, but I still was not happy with the large pimples deep under the skin that were coming up on my face, specifically on my chin and sides of my cheeks (which I've never in my life had a zit on my cheeks). I tried using the Cosrx Pimple Patches

name: Tanner Russ
title: New flavor is not good
content: I‚Äôve been using these for well over a year. Just received a new bottle. The bottle is different, color is different, and the taste is bad! They must have changed something!!

name: lisa
title: Still waiting for results
content: Bought them with high hopes because of reviews I‚Äôve read. I purchased the 3 bottle supply.I‚Äôve started my second bottle and haven‚Äôt noticed a change. Fingers crossed by the time I finish my 3rd I will see a difference.

name: Figletf
title: After many guestions about the green color
content: I bought these directly from the SugarBear site and they are not blue they are green.They do look different though.The feet are smaller and there is an emblem on the tummy and back of the ones from the SugarBear site

name: kyle
title: Their suppose to be blue
content: These were a weird color

name: flacracker
title: Not for me
content: I got these for my nails. My nails were peeling/dry. I didn't notice a difference in my hair, but I have fairly healthy hair. May just try something else. I have used these for 2 months.

name: Melissa
title: There's a trade off...
content: While this product made my hair "seem" thicker. For the several months that I tried it I've developed horrible cystic acne. So having Fuller hair is not worth the drawback of having cystic acne all over my face and my neck. I've taken biotin supplements prior to this and I wanted to try this vitamin because of the hype that it received online. However I will go back to taking biotin because that gave me no side effects with acne.. naturally people get breakouts every now and then but I've noticed a significant difference in the amount of breakouts I've had and the type of breakouts that I've had and I'm just not willing to have that type of reaction just to get maybe at most an inch hair growth a month.. Another issue is the cost. You can find a supplement that does the same exact thing that this product does for a lot less than $30 a month. You're paying for the hype and the name and I'd rather buy a bottle of biotin that has no other ingredients in it for $14 or less. And not have ridiculous acne on my face.

name: Mrs. HH
title: Eh... they're ok.
content: Not the miracle I was hoping for. Getting older and my hair has started to thin. I thought these would help rejuvenate my hair and thicken it up a bit. No such luck. I thought they were quite expensive and they just didn't seem to help much, if at all. I also tried some other knock offs and no luck there either. I'm not sure you can take it for just 30 days and expect to see a difference. Sorry to disappoint, but they didn't do much for me.

name: Bought-it-Critique
title: Brush arrived with black mold on it!!
content: Vitamins good, seller & packaging bad. Concerned for my health returning stuff. Black mold on brush and build up of gunk & dust on brush. OMGOSH awful üòñ üò± üò´

name: molliebeth
title: afraid to  take these vitamins- they look completely different color, unsure if they are safe.
content: Afraid to use the new bottle - color and texture appears different.

name: Jenn K
title: Old!
content: My most recent order tastes old and look discolored. MFG date 2020 / Exp date 10/22, so not expired but sure taste and look it. I won‚Äôt make this mistake again.

name: Ann
title: Made me break out. Not worth it.
content: I read many of the reviews about breaking out and I tried it anyway. I only ate 1 gummy each day to avoid a break out but after a few days I started seeing pimples. I normally get one every once in awhile but this was a complete break out. I did notice some baby hairs started to grow so I‚Äôm sure the product does in fact work but it‚Äôs not worth it to have a face full of painful pimples.

name: David M. Madden
title: First I will say that the taste is similar to ...
content: First I will say that the taste is similar to Swedish Fish, which I'm fine with. I'm not sure if I've seen any difference in my hair and nails, however... I'm going two stars due to only trying for a month. I imagine I should need to go longer for real results, but I discontinued use for the following reasons:. 1) Acne. And I'm talking big, cystic zits on the sides of my back. I will not post a photo because GROSS. This began about two weeks in, and nothing had changed in my diet except for these vitamins.. 2) You know how you pee out excessive toxins and nutrients from vitamins? These are 1600% your required Biotin. The result for me? My urine smelled. I'm talking I could notice it from a distance. I discontinued use of SugarBearHair a few days ago and the smell disappeared. Coincidence? Again, no change in my diet except SBH.. These two grody things might fade after a more prolonged investment, but no thanks.

name: Jesus Almanza
title: Side effects
content: Before I made my purchase I read some reviews how some women noticed some break out while they were taking Sugar Bear Hair. I also read how women who were getting these effects were most likly allergic to the B12 in these gummies. I have taken B12 before and I never experienced this side effect so I bought them thinking I would be okay, but I was wroooooong. I started breaking out in my chin, when one pimple would go away another one was start to come out. With 1 month I did notice a difference in my hair as well as my nails but I wouldn't trade my hair & nails for my clear skin. I have highlights and I can see how quickly my roots are coming out this month compared to all the others. I will not be buying these again, but if you don't mind the break out they do work! Andddddddd I did notice I was more awake in the mornings without having to drink coffee or tea, but again I'd rather have clear skin.

name: MiiMii
title: Chewbacca and swallow
content: These vitamins are the rave on instagram amongst influencers so my hair wasn't growing much so I gave it a shot. Idk if its hormone based, body based or Chewbacca based but these did nothing for my hair! However I did manage to have an increase in eyebrow hair and a lovely mustache, lets just say I was on a verge of beating my husband on a facial hair race! I think there needs to be a bit more information on who it works better or how it works if that makes sense. I used it for about 3 months and then stopped bc of the excess facial hair. They are cute and yummy to eat, maybe I have to taker half a pill?

name: Amazon Customer
title: Warning!
content: I got these gummies and was supper excited so I told my family members to try them out too. All the family members that consumed these gummies had A VERY BAD ACNE BREAKOUT including me. For some it was unusual since they have very clear skin. So just trying to inform that they may or may not be good for hair but VERY BAD FOR SKIN!

name: Theresa
title: Something is off
content: I‚Äôve gotten these vitamins before and I was in love and would give them 5 stars. However this time I ordered them and I received something different. The gummies I received had been badly misshapened and tasted strange. I suspect that they are old or had been in temps that are unsuitable. I will buy these in store from now on.

name: heather
title: Become Less cute daily gummies
content: It‚Äôs cute how I‚Äôve never ever had acne in my entire life than all of a sudden nothing I do will get rid of it since I started taking these gummies. Honestly I really really wanted to like these because of how ‚Äúcute‚Äù these gummies are. But I want to be cute .... not worth 30$ sorry.. if you really are what you say you are u need to do better than that. I‚Äôve purchased Olly at Walmart before these and they literally did wonders for my hair and nails for about half this price they worked better. For profit like yours your product should really be top of the line. If u put in as much effort as you do advertising.. Yours truly,. Less cute üëé

name: Amazon Customer
title: I BROKEOUT AFTER ONE WEEK
content: I‚Äôve read mixed reviews about this product. some people say it works great for them and others say it made them breakup. i bought it anyways because i‚Äôve never had problems with my skin. ive always had clear skin and rarely get any pimples. after one week and a half of trying this product, i could see a difference in my skin.. i have pimples ALL over my face and im starting to get some on my back. these pictures were taken about 5 days after I stopped taking sugarbear... they dont even show how bad my face got. NOW, this happened after one week and a half of taking these gummies!!! Im trying Halo Beauty‚Äôs Hair, skin and nails product and im loving it!!! I recommend you get that instead, its a little pricey but better than Sugar Bear which contains pure sugar.

name: Jo Harrell
title: Longer hair maybe but acne more likely as well
content: My daughter and many of her friends have been taking these for a few months now. I decided to order some a few weeks ago. While it's too soon to see a difference in my hair my, my skin is awful. My scalp is also itching like crazy. ACNE on my chin, jawline and as of this morning, my forehead. I'm 47! My daughter (21) has also been experiencing acne as well after starting the gummies. I decided to do some research on the side effects of too much biotin. One of the first, "ACNE on the chin and jawline due to overproduction of sebum" While the product may eventually give you longer hair, you may just end up needing it to cover your breakouts. If you have super dry skin this product may be helpful. Otherwise be prepared for much oilier skin.

name: richy
title: Acne/breakout
content: I was literally 2 days in and I started breaking out right away. Unfortunately like many other buyers here, I'm not really prone to pimples/acne, I dont even use any actual facial cleanser or anything. Just soap and water and my skin has been pretty decent. Pimples here and there but very far apart. I couldnt get a good picture but i also broke out on my nose. Its unfortunate that i spent 35 dollars and i had the acne reaction. :/ i took a picture of my problem areas where i hoped my hair would grow. I am going to stop the gunmies and see how my skin improves and ill update the review.

name: Ms Mac
title: Not cute (or safe) enough for the price
content: Very cute branding and good social media marketing lured me in. I love the taste and the fact these are made with coconut oil instead of gelatin. But when I can get the same amount of biotin for a fraction of the cost, makes no sense to spend so much money. There are gummy biotin out there for $7.99. But alas, I can't resist these cute little bears, so to make them last I only take one per day.. I was alarmed to read that biotin can mess with your hormones. It is a trendy "supplement" that is not regulated. I can't get any standard recommended daily amount. It ranges from 30 to 2500 mcg. This stuff is way over the safe amount! So when this bottle is done, I'm likely done. I'm not sure about hair growth being any more than normal.

name: Carmen
title: Taste good, but no significant results
content: I tried these for 7 months. They taste great and were easy to take. I was taking Folexin for two months and saw results, but didn‚Äôt want to take capsules anymore and decided to try these. There are a couple of key ingredients that through trial and error, I now know work for me: Bamboo and Horsetail. These gummies don‚Äôt have those ingredients. It has a good amount of Biotin and that may work for you. Overall, it did not produce the results that I was expecting to see. Going back to my prior vitamins.

name: Kristen
title: Caused a major break out
content: I don't ever review things but I felt like I should-. These are really popular and I kept hearing about them so I figured I would try them. All this is is biotin, so you are paying extra for the pretty packaging. A few of my friends and I tried these to see if it really made a difference and I guess I saw a small improvement but ALL of us had major break outs. Like full blown cystic acne break out. The more I talk to people about them the more they tell me they broke out too. They are cute and I see the appeal but I wish I would have had someone tell me about the breakout it because I'll wear hair extensions before I'll take on acne-- so if you have acne prone skin at all I would stay away!

name: Jennifer Troche
title: Didn't work for me
content: I bought this product for my hair, since it was damaged and breaking after years and years of consistently using hot tools. I decided to not write a review until a full three months to give the product and opportunity to do what it says. Although, the gummies are delicious they did not do anything for my hair. They did in fact do something for my skin. I broke out around month 2 and thought maybe I was just breaking out. But then I realized this was the only thing that had really changed and within a week after I stopped taking them, I stopped breaking out as well. I'm not saying this product doesn't work, just didn't work for me.

name: Megan
title: Not worth the oily skin and acne
content: I think it actually does make your hair grow faster, but it does nothing for the hair you already have (if anything its even dryer) and ever since starting them I have had one never ending acne flare.. I would rather be a pretty Megan with slightly shorter hair than a long haired pimply Megan anyday.

name: Simone C.
title: Loved the taste but not for me (I'm black, Caribbean descent)
content: The product came and it wasn't damaged, good packaging. The gummies taste really good, like Welches fruit snacks. I have taken Hair, Skin & Nails vitamins before and they worked but very slowly and I thought I started seeing results after 4 weeks but then I started to BREAK OUT!!! All over my cheeks and lower chin, it is so annoying!! It also affected my digestion for awhile (won't get into details). I drink gallons of water and that didn't help. I am going to try the Hairfinity. I can't understand how something that helps you hair tastes like candy and broke me out like I was actually eating candy like crazy. I'm disappointed. Seems like black women don't have success with this product.

name: laevero
title: Did not see any effects after a month of taking vitamins.
content: I just finished my first bottle of 60 SugarBears, which I took 2 a day for a month. I really wanted to believe all the positive reviews and hoped this would finally help my hair grow, but I honestly did not see any changes in length or thickness of my hair or nails. The taste of the gummies reminds me of the pink lemonade flavoring with juuust a hint of plastic. On the plus side, at least these vitamins did not make my skin break out, which was a fear of mine based on some of the reviews I read. So overall, I‚Äôm glad I finally tried these after a long time of considering it, but I will not be getting another bottle since I saw no effects from the first one.

name: Heidi-2-
title: Not Impressed.
content: Normally I don't write reviews, but I figured I could maybe help if I did, so here it goes. The only thing good about this is the taste (this is why I gave it two stars). Just like the majority of the other reviews, it made me break out A LOT. I've been off of it for about two weeks now, and just now am I starting to see my breakouts from this product go away..I was constantly wondering how I was getting all this acne randomly, and then towards the end of my supply I remembered everyone else's review that said they got bad breakouts. As for hair growth, not much, although I did only take it for 1 month like it says, nothing phenomenal at all. Good luck if you decide to take this for 1 month+.

name: Kaytee Bell
title: Bad acne!
content: After having a baby my hair started to thin and was falling out. I feel like it slowed the hair shedding, but it gave me terrible acne. I took these for about 2 months and had to stop. After being off them for a few days my face started to heal, but now over a week later I am still dealing with issues from them.

name: Montana H.
title: Caused acne
content: I took the vitamins for one week and it caused acne all over my face. I typically do not have this issue so I was disappointed that I wasted money.

name: criSpa
title: Not for aging hair
content: I‚Äôve been taking this product For about a year and initially I felt it helped with my hair shedding but over time I noticed that my hair continued to thin out and did more research on some of the ingredients which are not so healthy. I do not recommend this for people with aging hair. I am over 40 and I don‚Äôt feel like this is a vitamin you can continue to take and get the results that you want. The taste also becomes over redundant after a while and got sick of the taste...it‚Äôs very sweet.

name: jessjlt7
title: Break outs
content: I was so hopeful for this product ... The gummy vitamins do taste good - and for any 90‚Äôs babies, they almost take like Scooby-Doo fruit snacks. I have been taking them for about 3 months and haven‚Äôt noticed any positive differences. I have such a hard time growing my hair out and it hasn‚Äôt done anything for it, but maybe just a little thicker. It did though cause me an awful breakout on my face, and when that went away it moved to my chest. I have NEVER broken out on my chest until now and it‚Äôs awful. Really wished these would of worked like they were supposed to

name: Kortney
title: Great results bad side effects
content: I have been taking SugarBear Hair vitamins for 2 months now. I had great results, more volume and length to my hair and my nails have never been healthier. However my face has been extremely oily which I never had an issue with before and I started breaking out a lot near my jawline. Mind you I very rarely have breakouts. Also, my hair has been extremely oily which I never had this issue before I took the vitamins. I drink plenty of water as you should with taking this much Biotin. Sadly I have cancelled my subscription because the side effects are not worth it for me.

name: Octavia Alford
title: Read the side effects
content: I‚Äôve been taking these for about 3 months and I went from the suggested dosage to 1/4 the suggested amount. You‚Äôre suppose to take 2x a day. I took 1 every other day. Why- because what no one tells you is that your damn face will break OUT.. literally taste great, flavor is delicious, but value for your money he‚Äôll no cause I had to buy pills and cream from the dermatologist to correct what this sugar bear pimple producers gave me ... but on the lighter note my hair did grow a lot

name: Hannah Bodenstein
title: Flavor changed
content: I was very happy with this product until about 2 months ago it started tasting like fish oil. I thought maybe it was the particular container, so I waited till my next subscription delivery. Unfortunately, it had the same strong and, to me, offensive taste. I cancelled my subscription. I do want to say that I was quite happy with the taste up until then... it's a shame. I am still using the regular pink one.

name: Imani Payne
title: Taste good but it breaks you out!
content: Sugarbear taste delicious of course and I have two weeks of gummy left. So I will update my review depending on the results. I have see that some strands of the hair on the back of my head have grown back to a reasonable length (they broke from dyeing). I have yet to actually calculate the results but I will tell you if you have acne prone skin or hormonal acne it will break you out really badly :(. I'm starting on acne.org regimen because of it.. Update: the straight hair are before pics and the curly hair is the most recent after my sugarbear experience. I didn't notice a difference in length that was worth the breakouts but it tasted good...

name: Gaby
title: No huge difference, caused a lot of acne
content: The gummies taste very good took them for about 4 months (4 bottles) and only noticed a little difference in hair growth, didn't grow as much as I thought it would but that could be because my hair is very slow growing.... bad thing is they made me break out so bad! I have never had this many pimples in my life! Store bought biotin has never caused so many breakouts and I take more mcg a day with those in my opinion these gummies work the same as the biotin I buy at Wal-Mart except I don't break out as much with the Wal-Mart ones.

name: Natalie Martinez
title: Not impressed
content: These do absolutely nothing for me. Oh wait, one thing they do do is make my pee smell horrible. For my hair thigh they‚Äôve done nothing at all after three months.

name: Amazon Customer
title: Might not suit everyone
content: I read really good reviews about the product, but unfortunately this product didn‚Äôt work well for me. I started about bad acne after starting to use it. Initially I used twice a day and later chatting once a day to see if any improvement is noticed. But unfortunately I had to stop taking it as the acne was getting worse.

name: L.owen
title: Odd color
content: I'm very disappointed, I've ordered these vitamins 4 different times now. The last order I got the flavor was odd and the color is a greenish color vs the blue color I have had in the past.

name: Casie Marie
title: IF YOU‚ÄôRE ACNE PRONE BEWARE!
content: Taste good, price was doable, BUT IF YOU SUFFER FROM OR USED TO SUFFER FROM ACNE. It‚Äôs not worth it. A week after I stopped taking them my face/skin immediately started looking normal again.

name: Danielle Hayes
title: Title
content: They didn‚Äôt work

name: Amazon Customer
title: Does work, but can cause breakouts
content: I decided to give these a try after seeing all the Bachelor/Bachelorette women that endorse it. I ordered a one month supply and after about 2 weeks, I was seeing great results. My hair typically grows really slow, but it's grown almost an inch in the 2-3 weeks I was taking them. It was looking shinier and healthier too. Unfortunately, I've noticed that my skin is breaking out horribly, like many others have noted. I'm already acne prone and have oily skin, but I've never broken out this bad in my life. I'm stopping these immediately to hopefully help my skin. I'm really sad since the vitamins were actually helping my hair, but it's just not worth the terrible skin.

name: Jamie R.
title: Taste terrible
content: I‚Äôve had these vitamins before and they tasted great! I had never ordered them from Amazon but they would ship quicker through Amazon than though the Sugar Bear site so I went ahead and ordered them. They taste terrible! I thought they might be expired but the expiration date is May 2021. I‚Äôm not sure if they have changed the formula or if I got a bad batch but I threw them away.

name: Natalita
title: Not the best results. Maybe good for sensitive people, not as strong.
content: I wanted to love these but I can see difference in my nails‚Ä¶unfortunately Costco brand wins, and by far. I am not sure why. I just switched for half of jar of this new brand, but it was not doing the job.

name: mom22boys
title: Welcome to Breakouts!
content: These are delicious and it took me starting the second bottle before I realized I was starting to break out. Breakouts are normal every now and then, right? Well, not for me. I am blessed to have a beautiful complexion (everyone elses words, not mine) and even at 41, I have NEVER had any skin issues, until I started these vitamins. I'm not even sure what ingredient in them causes it but I'm not taking this anymore. I have been taking any brand of Biotin for years without any breakouts and I am just going to stick with that.

name: Tahis
title: Doesn't work - save your money!
content: I don't know how to feel about this. It's like it helped my hair feel a LITTLE TEENSY BIT thicker BUT I HAD SO MUCH SHEDDING. I was almost scared. I haven't finished using it because at this point I don't really think it works. My hair does not feel any different NOR healthier. Everytime I washed my hair, more and more hair fell out. I thought it was because it maybe was shedding dead hair and making the hair be at the same cycle but I wouldnt recommend. It tastes great and it is an easy product to use but most people who claim it works are being paid to say so...save your money.

name: Nellie Marie
title: It can cause breakouts
content: I had to stop using it because it caused me to break out. I‚Äôm not sure if it works or not because it was so early on, but be aware.

name: Ro
title: Got cystic acne!!!! I have always had clear skin!
content: I took these gummies for 3 months. At first i got 1 small pimple here and there but I thought it was from stress. I've never had acne before and my skin has always been super clear! After the 3rd month I had giant pimples and red bumps everywhere so I stopped taking the vitamins immediately. Now it's been 3 weeks and I still have pimples surfacing :( it's awful. The picture is after i stopped taking the vitamins and let my face heal for 3 weeks

name: Paige Ayres
title: Bummed. Good taste, but major headaches
content: I was totally bummed. These little things actually tasted good to me. I hate taking vitamins to begin with, so when I tried these I was excited because they taste good. However I started getting headaches the very first day I began taking them. I waited it out for more than a week hoping the headaches would stop, but unfortunately they didn't. I don't get headaches often so whatever were in these, my body just couldn't handle.

name: Jane
title: SugarBearHair: Great Hair, Terrible Breakouts.
content: After reading numerous reviews stating that SugarBearHair caused lots of breakouts, I decided to go against my better judgment to try them out, only to be left disappointed. After taking SugarBearHair for about two weeks, my skin started breaking out more, and the breakouts that I already had on my face became inflamed. On the bright side, my hair became smoother and shinier, compared to how my hair was coarse and dull before. Needless to say, I won't be ordering or taking these again. They were a waste of money, considering how many breakouts they caused.

name: Robin billiu
title: Great flavor
content: Made with natural strawberries & im allergic to real strawberries. I didn‚Äôt realize that they were made with strawberries guess I didn‚Äôt read it carefully when ordering. Just thought they were blue so didn‚Äôt think they were real strawberry.

name: JessiW
title: Was very hopefully but let down
content: Used these vitamins for 3 months and it did not help me grow my head hair. It did make my body hair grow out of control!! Like having to shave, wax and pluck daily! It also threw my cycle off BAD! Made me 39 days late one month and the next month I bled for 16 days- never in my life have I ever had an irregular cycles like those. Once I stopped the vitamins, everything went back to normal (thank goodness).

name: Amazon Customer
title: Not bad not good.
content: I have fine hair that does not grow very quickly, and I decided to try SugarBearHair gummies since so many celebrities swear by them. I bought a 30-day bottle and took two gummies every morning for 31 days. *unless my husband snuck a gummie, there were only 61 gummies which is enough for 30.5 days.. I think my hair grew a little bit, but it didn't seem to grow much faster than it normally does. I even took before and after pictures, and my hair MAY have grown 1/3-1/2 of an inch.. I didn't experience crazy breakouts like some people reported, but I use Proactive products so that may have helped.. I did experience some digestive changes however. Apparently my body doesn't respond well to heightened levels of biotin because I gain weight every time. I eat healthily and exercise 4-5 times a week and I gained about 3 lbs while taking these vitamins.. I gave it a 2/5 because the gummies at least taste good.. Overall, is the product bad? No. But would I spend $30 again for less than impressive results? Probably not.

name: Jennazon
title: Add Extra Sugar into your Diet - Available Now!
content: Does no one realize these things are literally just sugar supplements ? The main ingredients glucose syrup aka a type of sugar. It's insane that people are eating these types of vitamins as a health food when they're just adding a whole lot of sugar into their diet.. The building block of hair aka what your hair is made of, is Amino Acids (broken down Protein) and these vitamins don't contain any protein. They also don't contain Iron which is a key mineral to the growth of hair (low Iron = hair loss).. Blue 1? Titanium Dioxide? ---- Really?. Have really low Iron levels (genetic) and was very interested in these then I realized what I got.. Definitely tastes good, but not that much worth what you're paying for.. Thanks SugarBear. Why can't we just get the vitamins itself and fruit/veggie based colorings instead?

content: Read lots of reviews online before purchasing these. Ordered directly from the website so I know I got an authentic product.. Well this reported that it had way more biotin than it claimed which is the culprit of breakouts from taking supplements.. I was halfway through my first month and my face erupted with large, painful nodule acne. I have stopped taking the supplement so this will clear up, I was worried this would happen when I saw that lab rating.. It did seem to help my hair somewhat. But it's not worth the breakouts. They included pantothenic acid which is supposed to help balance out the biotin, but if there is more of that than they report having in the gummies it's not going to make a difference. I guess adding an additional pantothenic acid supplement would help but still not worth the price in my eye.
