name: Abby
title: Did not work for me!
content: I‚Äôm not sure if these vitamins were re-formulated since they first came out, but I‚Äôm definitely not a happy customer! I took them a few years ago and they helped restore moisture and shine to my hair after it was damaged during a diy bleaching disaster. I had NO issues with the vitamins whatsoever, and only stopped taking them because I needed to cut back on expenses at the time. I just ordered these a week ago and have been taking them as instructed on the bottle. I‚Äôve noticed my hair, in general, is softer and has a little more shine than normal. My nails are noticeably less brittle, as well. But my skin is OILY AF! I was on accutane as young adult and haven‚Äôt had acne in YEARS. I usually struggle with dry/combination skin in fact. I‚Äôve developed large pores and small bumps on my cheeks/forehead that didn‚Äôt exist prior to me taking the vitamins. Nothing has changed in my diet or skin care routine, except for these gummies. Not to mention, this is only my 7th day in, and I‚Äôve been having stomach set for the last two days. It could be something else, but I suspect it‚Äôs something in vitamins that isn‚Äôt agreeing with me. The bottle/packaging looks slightly different from before, so maybe that should have been my first clue. Either way, oily skin and upset stomach are not worth it for me. You don‚Äôt know until you try it for yourself, but I‚Äôm definitely bummed I cannot return them now and would hate for someone else to waste their money like I just did!

name: R.R.Pauli
title: Overpriced Fad
content: These are an overpriced gummy vitamin. The Kardashians are not registered dietitians, I have never seen their show, but am aware now that their endorsement is how these things became so popular; not because the product itself works well enough to charge this much for them. If you want to look like a Kardashian, save your money by buying a different supplement, take the money you saved, and go see a cosmetic surgeon: that‚Äôs their secret. Not their products and not this stuff. An Expert Witness does not mean someone who has seen a cosmetic surgeon, gets a service from them, and is on TV and chronicles their life of toxic drama. That doesn‚Äôt make you a registered dietitian or a dermatologist or a cosmetic surgeon. The cosmetic surgeon might also have better recommendations for other products that actually work. There are other supplements out there for around $9.99 that do the same thing this does. It‚Äôs a pointless fad for the price. This is a placebo effect if people are willing to spend this kind of money for so little. When I bought it, I saw the high reviews, didn‚Äôt do my research on why this item was so popular, and did not look at the amount. I incorrectly assumed that for the price - I would be receiving a fair amount, an amount that would make it competitive with other products that are the exact same thing. I was a little taken back by the small size and amount when I received it. That‚Äôs when I did my research. This is popular because of a ‚Äúcelebrity‚Äù endorsement; not because it works better. A simple celebrity couldn‚Äôt possibly speak to it‚Äôs effectiveness; only an expert witness and properly conducted research would be able to speak to that. Anything short of that should be labeled false advertising. We live in a world where we are falling behind in our STEM, particularly when it comes to women in the STEM. This product demonstrates that and does so while taking your lunch money right from under your nose. Don‚Äôt buy it: return it if you did.

name: J. Knight
title: Worst cystic acne of my life!
content: Please look these up before you start taking them. An independent lab did an analysis of them and they contain high levels of lead and other ingredient inaccuracies.. After taking these vitamins for three weeks it caused me to break out in the worst cystic acne I‚Äôve had since I was a teenager. I‚Äôm talking about the type of painful acne where it feels like a knot under your skin but it doesn‚Äôt come to a head. I broke out along my neck, jaw, cheek, chin, lip and temples. I attached a picture that shows one side. This is with makeup on and you can still see how bad it looks. I know biotin can cause breakouts but this is something worse. I ended up going to a doctor who told me my body is reacting to some ingredient in the ‚Äúvitamins‚Äù. Another thing I noticed is when I had my hair recently colored my hair fried which is something new as well. I‚Äôve changed nothing in my diet and my hair dresser used the same products she‚Äôs been using for years. Even she couldn‚Äôt understand what happened.. I know there are a lot of positive reviews but I wanted to leave my review to say be careful. If you start taking them and start to notice acne stop immediately. To me it is not worth it. It has been a week since I stopped taking them and although my acne hasn‚Äôt increased it still looks terrible. I hope that it clears up soon. Imagine taking something to make you feel better and you end up feeling worse and insecure too. Another thing I learned is if you are acne prone It is better to take silica for hair growth instead of biotin. I‚Äôm waiting now until my face completely clears up to try anything else. I hope others have better luck.

title: Shopping is like playing Where's Waldo
content: Out of curiosity, I ordered a few bottles from both Amazon and the official website. I ended up having a fun time looking for the difference‚Ä¶. If you say we should allow a product packaging to have a different iterations, sure‚Ä¶ but at least keep your product logo the same, or keep the supplement facts the same, or keep your paragraph spacing the same‚Ä¶ or the font. The one from Amazon looks really dry and hard. When I shook the bottle, it sounded like rocks. I tried one from the original website. The texture is moist, soft and melty with oil blended in. The original website gummies have a bear logo on the bear‚Äôs belly whereas the Amazon one don‚Äôt. See the evidence yourself and make the judgement.

name: Vanessa
title: Bears of Death: Pain Assured
content: My hair dresser referred me to this product, and I would not recommend it to ANYONE. After the first 30 days, I developed acne. At 34 years old, I formed deep pimples all over my face and body. My hair dresser said, "Yes, of course this happens to everyone as the body is getting used to it.". Halfway into my second bottle, I formed an infection so severe I wound up in the ER for pain. They had to slice into an infection in my hip to drain the puss TWICE while I was on morphine. Now I am on Bactrim a bacterial medication that kills even MRSA. I believe its important to note a few things.. 1) Not even as a teenager did I have zits. 2) I don't drink, smoke, or use drugs. 3) I do cardio 3 times a week, yoga, and rock climb.. 4) Yes, it was this product.. 5) I don't eat anything out of a box. Except these bears, which I obviously regret.. Within 72 hours of not taking the bears, my face and body began clearing. My only advice for anyone daring enough to take these vitamins is at the EARLIEST sign of warning like face acne- stop taking the product!!! The infection in my hip is the worst injury I have ever gone through. Pain is a level 10. A subcutaneous infection can form from the over production of oils. In other words, there isn't anything to "pop". It must be cut out, and they will to an MRI to make sure it hasn't reached essential organs.

content: I really wanted these to work because my hair seems to be growing at the slowest pace. A little background. I am 39 and have 3 kids so my hair texture has changed and doesn't grow in as fast and full as it use to :(. I think maybe if your younger and your lacking the important and essential vitamins for hair growth that maybe this could help. But I eat really healthy, take vitamins (I took these particular ones for 2 months) and I didn't see any noticable difference in my hair growth. I think they are delicious, the best chewable vitamin I have ever tasted. Their marketing is genius and maybe that is why they do so well. But they don't 'make your hair grow faster.' I have tried Viviscal as well and same thing; didn't work for me. I have read quite a bit about the hair growth cycles and genetics so there is only so much a vitamin can do when they are going against your hair genetics. Regardless, I am trying an expensive whole food pre natal now and seeing if that has any impact.

name: Amazon Customer
title: Acne and hair loss!!
content: I started this product and was happy at first, after a couple weeks of using it. My skin started breaking out excessively. I‚Äôve never battled acne like this before. I started getting pimples all over the place! When I stopped using it my hair started falling out in chunks! Do not use this product!

name: Karly Rosenbauer
title: Do not use if u have sensitive skin or stomach!!
content: My stomach started hurting the minute I took these also I broke out all over my face do not waste ur money.It may be different for some people. But they did not work out for me.

name: dawn anderson
title: Caused kidney failure
content: I had been taking these for about 3 weeks when I noticed a nagging pain in my left back side. I attributed it to poor posture from working from home. Funny thing is is for a week and a half I spent time trying to heal my back. It wasn‚Äôt my back that was the problem it was my left kidney. I took two of these as instructed per day. I am now sitting here writing to tell you this product is NOT safe and it clearly says has not been approved by the FDA. I woke up this morning with a brownish colored urine and knew right away it was my kidneys and not my back muscles. The amount of biotin in this product is not a normal amount for your kidneys to ‚Äúpee‚Äù and ‚Äúfilter‚Äù out. It‚Äôs way above it. Through the stratosphere above it. So if you find yourself taking these and suddenly your back hurts guess what? You just paid $30 for an extremely expensive hospital visit. I would not recommend these to anyone. They are unsafe and there is NO WARNING label on the ‚Äúvitamins.‚Äù Talk to your dr and show him or her how much biotin is in it and they will tell you how unsafe it is. It will damage your body

name: Hannah
title: This is making my hair fall out.
content: As I get older I have noticed my hair becoming slightly thinner. Nothing dramatic, my ponytail just isn't as full as it used to be. I wanted to try taking a vitamin to see if I could promote some hair growth. I have taken biotin before and didn't notice much of a difference at the time but I thought it was worth another shot. I figured that these would be just as good as any other biotin supplement with the added bonus of being cute and tasting good.. Well, they do taste good but that's about where the positives stop for me. Almost immediately I started breaking out in cystic acne, but I knew that was a potential side effect and I was willing to deal with some acne if it meant getting more hair. However, literally within a week of starting this supplement as directed my hair has begun falling out in CLUMPS. I know how much hair loss in the shower is normal for me, and I am losing outrageously more than I ever have before. I can't even run my fingers through my hair without pulling out handfuls. I am absolutely devastated and I am 100% sure that this product is to blame - nothing else about my haircare or nutrition routine has changed. Please skip this product and buy a regular biotin supplement at the drugstore or on amazon. I do not want anyone else to go through what is happening to me.

name: Amazon Customer
title: When asking if all the ingredients used to manufacture the ...
content: When asking if all the ingredients used to manufacture the product in the US are imported, and if so, from where, I get no response. Also, they do not show me a picture on the label showing that all ingredients and production is done in the US. I'm skeptical on any kind of supplement, especially that is popular among young tweens, that isn't transparent in their manufacturing. Also asked our doctor about it because their instructions say to ask an MD if a child under 13 want to use it. Our pediatrician looked it up and said not to use it.

title: Importante para ti

name: Pete T
title: Beware! Not all good
content: I had high hopes for this product with several people saying it helped curb the hair shedding. However I started using these and the next thing you know my fingernails became brittle and more hair began to fall out. It waste a waste for the money, didn‚Äôt even finish the bottle! I went back to a less pricey hair gummy and now my hair looks beautiful and my fingernails are growing again. Don‚Äôt believe the hype for these

name: Bargain Shopper
title: You're paying for the celebrity endorsements not vitamins
content: If you want a $32 bottle of gummy bears full of sugar go for it. You can buy the same thing for $8 at Target or Amazon. The only difference is that it's not endorsed by a celebrity so you have to pay for them to pose with a gummy in their mouth. Any good multivitamin of biotin will make your hair grow.

name: Prasanth Annam
title: Causes severe acne! Stay far away from it
content: I was so excited to try this out and one of my friend gave a very positive review 2 years back so I went ahead and bought 2 packs. From the day 2 itself, acne started breaking out and then full on cysts too... I completely stopped using it from day 5 and the packs are just lying there in my house. Stay far from it guys! It's not at all worth it

name: natalie morales
title: Caused bad side effects
content: After using this product for a month, it threw my cycle off! I am regular. I also experienced pain on my side and bellybutton. I stopped taking it and it seems like my body is trying to regulate itself. I hope that this review is read because I have been in the doctors office running all kinds of labs for pain and missing period. I noticed other women experienced the same issues. My hair became thicker but I also had to shave more .

name: Jimmie
title: Bad for skin
content: I don‚Äôt believe a lot of the five star reviews. Taking a hair and nail vitamins for a month or six weeks could not possibly affect growth and strength. People say it makes their nails less brittle but do they understand that the nail has to grow in. The vitamin doesn‚Äôt affect what‚Äôs already there.. Meanwhile, I took this product for a month and now have oily skin and blisters on my face. I pushed back the cuticles on my fingernails to see if there had been any change in the texture or health of the nails and there was nothing.

name: Mona
title: Do not waste your money!
content: Don't buy it!!. You want to waste your money?. You want to develop acne?. You want to be disappointed?. So, go ahead and buy this piece of meaningless junk!. I can not even return it! I was fooled to purchase this, I wasted my money otherwise spent on something useful and worthy.

name: Amazon Customer
title: Less supplement values than Kirkland vitamins
content: Not worth it. I have seen no results. I compared the values to other brands I've tried. This is by far the most expensive for the least amount of supplements. Costco's Kirkland brand it better and half the price. Hairfinity worked better and is still lower in price.

name: Amazon Customer
title: I would not recommend this to someone who breaks out

title: Horrible acne! DO NOT BUY!
content: So disappointed in these gummies. Wanted to invest in these as my hair was starting to thin as I got older. I am 34 years old and have the worst acne I have had since I was a teenager. I am at an age where I don't have breakouts - maybe a couple times a year I will get a pimple before my period or something but in general my skin is perfectly clear. In a matter of 3 weeks these vitamins have destroyed my skin. I am not talking about a pimple here or there, my face is FULL of acne breakouts all along my jawline, neck, chin and temples. The amount of money I have to invest in repairing my skin plus finding new hair vitamins really bums me out. DO NOT BUY THESE!
